alert.note: Alert for Cotton; Jefferson; Stephens (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 17 at 2:06AM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Jefferson, south central Stephens, southeastern Cotton, Clay and southeastern Archer Counties through 230 AM CST... At 206 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles northeast of Byers to 3 miles west of Henrietta to 5 miles southeast of Windthorst. Movement was northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Henrietta, Waurika, Ryan, Petrolia, Scotland, Byers, Dean, Windthorst, Terral, Bellevue, Jolly, Hastings, Addington, Sugden, Newport, Lake Arrowhead, Waurika Lake, Bluegrove, Taylor and Shannon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
